content.rendered:
Photo by Minimography

This Week in Genesis (#21) there’s a very special guest on the UK Genesis podcast; amazing new themes (and theme teases) from the Genesis community; plus, a whole lot of love in the showcase.

Let’s get to it.

Themes

First up this week, two new themes.

The first by Shivanand Sharma, over at Binary Turf, entitled Xposure. (Plus he’s doing a giveaway of the theme till 12 October).

Free Giveaway—>Xposure #genesiswp child theme https://t.co/hE2vXVFYV7 pic.twitter.com/vNNfyco80s

— Shivanand Sharma (@ShivanandWP) October 6, 2015

And while we’re on the theme of new themes beginning with ‘x’, here’s another new Genesis theme by the prolific folks over at ZigZagPress, called Xplorer.

Introducing our 27th fully loaded #genesiswp theme: Xplorer! http://t.co/500t14GqWq

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) October 6, 2015

Meanwhile Lindsey Riel of Pretty Darn Cute Design teases what, I can only assume, will be a new travel theme, Journey.

Shhhhh… I've been working on something 😉 #WordPress #GenesisWP #Travel #TravelBlogger #WebDesign https://t.co/3IYyRADECo

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) October 7, 2015

And finally – and I’m not quite sure if I should put this in showcase or theme the section, but either way – Brian Gardner is teasing a great new design for his personal site.

Fresh homepage design for me — http://t.co/v1ivnRMsqE #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) October 7, 2015

Showcase

First up this week in the showcase is a great new site from Jackie D’Elia for buchanansplants.com

My latest project just went live http://t.co/9HHwEPdZdg #GenesisWP #WordPress pic.twitter.com/AQ2FrGDbjl

— Jackie D'Elia (@SavvyJackie) October 7, 2015

Patricia Alix Villa has a great new site for noleensliney.com

Another web design project launched! Do check out http://t.co/YjNgnQCWAr. 🙂 #genesiswp #WordPress #webdesign

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) October 6, 2015

A beautiful design for starfishcottageblog.com from Stephanie Hellwig.

Really excited to launch an new #genesiswp #WordPress redesign for Kristy of http://t.co/EpKYgP9Aa6

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) October 2, 2015

A great customisation of Lindsey Riel’s Pretty Creative theme by Almazia for ebonycattouse.com

Love, love, love this customization of the new Pretty #Creative theme! http://t.co/8QCl9QjtEJ by @almazia #genesiswp

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) October 5, 2015

And finally, showcase regular Shaan Nicol pops up with a good example of what you can build with Beaver Builder and Genesis in this website for greencorridorrun.com.sg

Some more #genesiswp #showcase – Something quick I built for an existing client in Beaver Builder today – http://t.co/M891XeJvKF

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) October 8, 2015

Plus, another site from Shaan (presumably built without Beaver Builder ;), arenatv.com.au

Podcasts

I’ve been mentioning for a couple of weeks and it was worth the wait.

The UK Genesis Podcast spoke to WordPress co-founder Mike Little this week and it’s no disrespect to their other podcast episodes to say this was my favourite one so far, covering everything from page builders to accessibility to Genesis (of course).

If you couldn’t catch it live, make sure you catch the replay. Hats off to Jo Waltham and Gary Jones for a great job.

We're live with @mikelittlezed1! #genesiswp #WordPress: http://t.co/6ndT37YtGw pic.twitter.com/4PoXqMRBsP

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) October 7, 2015

Meanwhile over on the Office Hours Podcast, Carrie Dils spoke to Eric Hamm who you may know as the founder of Cobalt Apps, who make a couple of cool Genesis tools, the Dynamic Website Builder and Genesis Extender.

Very excited to have @cobaltapps founder @EricHamm on the show this week! Join us Thursday at 2pET! http://t.co/iD1CUxXAUK

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) October 5, 2015

Tutorials

Finally there seem to have been a lot of tutorials in the air this week so I’ve included three of the most interesting and potentially useful ones below.

First up Marcy Diaz walks you through how to add a retina logo to your Genesis theme.

Add Retina Logo to Genesis or WordPress Themes https://t.co/PRDAyqwW9l via @mjsdiaz1

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) October 4, 2015

Next, Jo Waltham with a good post on customising comment dates in Genesis 2.2.

Customising Comment Date in Genesis 2.2 http://t.co/lTj1daIe1T #genesiswp

— Jo Waltham (@JoWaltham) October 3, 2015

And finally the folk over at Handsome Press share a tutorial on setting up related posts with thumbnails in Genesis.

#Tutorial: Related Posts with Thumbnails in Genesis. https://t.co/0H4hdlkBmR #WordPress #genesiswp

— Handsome Press (@HandsomePress) October 9, 2015

That’s all for this week. My thanks to everyone for making and sharing all the great stuff above and Keeping Genesis Awesome.

Till next week, big love.

PS Did you subscribe already? You didn’t? Subscribe!

excerpt.rendered: WordPress co-founder Mike Little on the UK Genesis podcast; amazing new Genesis themes (and theme teases); plus, a whole lot of love in the showcase.
